Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

TestResult.description: The text term used to describe the result of the molecular test. If the test result was a numeric value see test_value. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

TestUnits.description: The text term used to describe the units of the test value for a molecular test. This property is used in conjunction with test_value. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

TestValue.description: The text term or numeric value used to describe a specific result of a molecular test. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here

TimepointLabel.description: Label to identify the time point at which the clinical data or biospecimen was obtained (e.g. Baseline, End of Treatment, Overall survival, Final). NO PHI/PII INFORMATION IS ALLOWED.

Transcript.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the transcript of a specific genetic variant. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

VariantOrigin.description: The text term used to describe the biological origin of a specific genetic variant. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

VariantType.description: The text term used to describe the type of genetic variation.

Zygosity.description: The text term used to describe the zygosity of a specific genetic variant.

CNSLeukemiaStatus.description: The status of central nervous system leukemia at the time of diagnosis.

Component.description: Category of metadata (e.g. Diagnosis, Biospecimen, scRNA-seq Level 1, etc.); provide the same one for all items/rows.

HTANParticipantID.description: HTAN ID associated with a patient based on HTAN ID SOP (eg HTANx_yyy )

MRDALLDiagnosticSensitivity.description: The assay sensitivity results of a diagnostic assessment of Minimal Residual Disease in patients diagnosed with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia.

NCIALLRiskGroup.description: The NCI risk group assigned to a patient at initial diagnosis with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia.

SpecimenBlastCountPercentageValue.description: The value, in percent(%) of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for blast cells, immature (undifferentiated) cells during diagnosis

StartDaysfromIndex.description: Number of days from the date of birth (index date) to the date of an event (e.g. exposure to environmental factor, treatment start, etc.). If not applicable please enter 'Not Applicable'

StopDaysfromIndex.description: Number of days from the date of birth (index date) to the end date of the event (e.g. exposure to environmental factor, treatment start, etc.). Note: if the event occurs at a single time point, e.g. a diagnosis or a lab test, the values for this column is 'Not Applicable'

TimepointLabel.description: Label to identify the time point at which the clinical data or biospecimen was obtained (e.g. Baseline, End of Treatment, Overall survival, Final). NO PHI/PII INFORMATION IS ALLOWED.

CNSTumorPrimaryAnatomicSite.description: Primary tumor location in the central nervous system that comprise the tissues of the central nervous system (brain and spinal cord)-not covered in Tiers 1 and 2

GliomaSpecificMetastasisSites.description: Evidence of active brain metastasis including leptomeningeal involvement

GliomaSpecificRadiationField.description: A description of the location on or within the CNS where radiation was administered in a partcipant with glioma

InfraTentorialEpendymomaMolecularSubgrou.description: Text term to identify the molecular subgroup in a infra tentorial ependymoma

NeuroblastomaMYCNGeneAmplificationStatus.description: Neuroblastoma MYCN amplification or over-expression status

SupraTentorialEpendymomaMolecularSubgrou.description: Text term to identify the molecular subgroup in a supra tentorial ependymoma

BIRADSMammographyBreastDensityCategory.description: The category that describes the relative amount of different tissues present in the breast on a mammogram based on the updated 2015 edition of the American College of Radiology's Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System (BI-RADS) reporting guidelines.

BreastBiopsyProcedureFindingType.description: Text term to describe the result of the examination of the breast tissue specimen or fluid as related to the presence and nature of disease.

BreastCancerAllredEstrogenReceptorScore.description: The numeric Allred score, that is cell staining percentage plus intensity, to determine estrogen receptor status.

BreastCancerAssessmentTests.description: Text term to identify assessment tests done in participants during diagnosis

BreastCancerGenomicTestPerformed.description: Text term that represents the name of the genomic test performed for breast cancer.

BreastCarcinomaCentromere17CopyNumber.description: Result of Centromere 17 testing in a sample or specimen of metastatic breast carcinoma, expressed as a range of values.

BreastCarcinomaDetectionMethodType.description: The means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions performed in order to discover or identify breast cancer.

BreastCarcinomaERStainingIntensity.description: Text term to indicate the ER staining intensity on pathology assessment in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaERStatusPercentageValue.description: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed which captures the estrogen receptor level measured in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaEstrogenReceptorStatus.description: Text term to represent the overall result of Estrogen Receptor (ER) testing in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaHER2Centromere17Copynumbe.description: Number of Cells Counted for HER2 & Centromere 17 Copy Numbers in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaHER2Chromosome17Ratio.description: HER2 chromosome 17 ratio in participants with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaHER2RatioDiagnosis.description: HER2 ratio of the participant at diagnosis

BreastCarcinomaHER2Status.description: Text term to signify the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood or tissue for HER2 in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaHistologyCategory.description: Classification of the type of invasive breast carcinoma diagnosed based on histologic attributes.

BreastCarcinomaPRStainingIntensity.description: Text term to indicate the PR staining intensity on pathology assessment in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaPRStatusPercentageValue.description: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed which captures the progesterone receptor level measured in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaProgesteronerReceptorStat.description: Text term to represent the overall result of Progresterone Receptor (PR) testing in a participant with breast cancer

BreastCarcinomaSurgicalProcedureName.description: Text name of a surgical procedure performed for a person with a diagnosis of breast cancer

BreastImagingPerformedType.description: The kind of technology or method performed for screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy that aids in the visualization of the breast(s).

BreastQuadrantSite.description: The breast quadrant or structure from which the breast tissue specimen was removed for microscopic examination.

HER2BreastCarcinomaCopyNumberTotal.description: Result of HER2 Copy Number testing (in a participant with breast cancer), expressed as a range of values.

HormoneTherapyBreastCancerPreventionIndi.description: Did the patient receive hormonal therapy for prevention of breast cancer?

InvasiveDuctalBreastCarcinomaHistologicC.description: The histologic subtype for the most common type of invasive breast carcinoma.

InvasiveLobularBreastCarcinomaHistologic.description: The histologic subtype for an infiltrating lobular carcinoma of the breast.

MammaprintRiskGroup.description: Text term that represents the risk group for breast cancer as determined by assessment of the MammaPrint test.

MulticentricBreastCarcinomaPresentIndica.description: A response to indicate if there is breast cancer characterized by the presence of multiple cancerous tumors that originate from different clones and usually located in different quadrants of the breast.

MultifocalBreastCarcinomaPresentIndicato.description: A response to indicate if there is breast cancer characterized by the presence of multiple cancerous tumors that originate from the same clone and usually located in the same quadrant of the breast.

OncotypeRiskGroup.description: Text term that represents the risk group for breast cancer as determined by assessment of the Oncotype recurrence score.

PriorInvasiveBreastDisease.description: Text term to indicate prior invasive breast condition in the participant

COVID19AntibodyTesting.description: Text term that demonstrates the test results of immunoglobulin M (IgM) and immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibodies to the SARS-CoV-2 virus in subject serum samples.

COVID19CancerTreatmentFollowup.description: Indicator that describes if cancer treatment was modified for the patient due to COVID-19 infectious disorder

COVID19ComplicationsSeverity.description: Text term that retrospectively indicates the worst complications during COVID-19 infectious disorder in the patient.

COVID19CurrentStatus.description: The patient's current COVID-19 status of sign or symptom events or interventions

COVID19OccurrenceIndicator.description: The indicator that describes whether or not a COVID-19 infectious disorder occurred.

COVID19PositiveLabTestIndicator.description: The indicator that describes whether or not there was a COVID-19 positive test result.

CancerAssociatedGeneMutations.description: Type of inherited germline or other gene mutations that confers heightened susceptibility to cancer identified in patient history

Chewingtobaccodailyusecount.description: The quantity of daily use of tobacco, in the form of a plug, usually flavored, for chewing rather than smoking.

ConcomitantMedicationReceivedType.description: An enumerated list of the type of concomitant medication received by the patient.

Ecigvape30dayusenum.description: Number of days e-cigarettes or vaping device was used in the last 30 days

Ecigvapetimesperday.description: e-cig frequency of use (times per day—one “time” consists of around 15 puffs or lasts around 10 minutes)

Ecigvapeuse.description: Use of non-traditional cigarette nicotine delivery device (electronic cigarette, ENDS - electronic nicotine delivery system)

ExtentofTumorResection.description: The degree to which the lesion has been cut out, or resected.

FamilyMemberVitalStatusIndicator.description: The response indicates whether the family member of the patient with a history of cancer is alive. (Extension to GDC attributes in Family History Tier 1)

HereditaryCancerPredispositionSyndrome.description: History of presence of inherited genetic predisposition syndrome that confers heightened susceptibility to cancer in the patient.

Immunosuppression.description: The indicator that describes whether or not immunosuppressive therapy was administered.

KnownGeneticPredispositionMutation.description: A yes/no/unknown indicator to identify whether there is a known genetic predisposition mutation present in the patient.

LabTestsforMMRStatus.description: Laboratory tests used to evaluate the status of mismatch repair pathways

MismatchRepairSystemStatus.description: The text that best describes the condition or state of MMR (mismatch repair system) in the patient

ModeofCancerDetection.description: Text term used to describe the mode of cancer detection, like standard of care screening or random detection

MutationalSignatures.description: Mutational signatures identified in the patient, includes signatures linked to selected exogenous carcinogens, endogenous and enzymatic modification of DNA or defective DNA repair. Note: Include only outputs of tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only include data from a diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done.

OtherBiopsyResectionSite.description: A description of the location on or within the human body where the surgical biopsy/resection procedure was performed (Not covered under HTAN Clinical Data Tier 1)

PrecancerousConditionType.description: The classification of pre-cancerous cells found in a specific collection of data being studied by the Consortium for Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screen-Detected Lesions (MCL).

PriorSitesofRadiation.description: The anatomic location to which radiation treatment was administered to a patient prior to enrollment on a protocol.

SatelliteMetastasisPresentIndicator.description: A yes/no indicator to ask if intransit metastases or satellite lesions are present.

Secondhandsmokeexposureyears.description: The number of cumulative years of the patient's exposure to second-hand cigarette smoke

SentinelLymphNodeCount.description: Numeric count of sentinel lymph nodes.

SentinelNodePositiveAssessmentCount.description: The number or amount of metastatic neoplasms related to the confirmed presence of disease or specific microorganisms during examination of the first rounded mass of lymphatic tissue to which cancer is likely to spread from the primary tumor.

TumorExtranodalExtensionIndicator.description: The indicator to determine extranodal involvement or extent of the disease.

Typeofsmokeexposurecumulativeyears.description: The number of cumulative years of the patient's specific type of smoke exposure

ColonPolypOccurenceIndicator.description: Yes/No indicator to describe if the subject had a previous history of colon polyps as noted in the history/physical or previous endoscopic report (s).

ColorectalCancerDetectionMethodType.description: The means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions performed in order to discover or identify colorectal cancer

ColorectalCancerKRASIndicator.description: The yes/no/not applicable indicator that describes if patient has diagnosis of colorectal cancer with known KRAS.

ColorectalCancerTumorBorderConfiguration.description: The description of the border configuration of a colorectal tumor at pathologic assessment.

ColorectalPolypAdenomaType.description: Type of adenoma associated with the polyp

ColorectalPolypCount.description: The total number of polyps detected

ColorectalPolypNewIndicator.description: A yes/no response to a question that asks whether any new polyps greater or equal to two millimeter were identified.

ColorectalPolypShape.description: Shape of polyp identified in the participant

ColorectalPolypType.description: Type of polyp found in the participant

FamilyColonCancerHistoryIndicator.description: The indicator to designate if any first degree relative has a history of colorectal cancer.

FamilyHistoryColorectalPolyp.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to family medical history diagnosis of polypoid lesion that arises from the colon or rectum and protrudes into the lumen.

FamilyMedicalHistoryColorectalPolypDiagn.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to family medical history diagnosis of polypoid lesion that arises from the colon or rectum and protrudes into the lumen.

HistoryofPriorColonPolyps.description: Yes/No indicator to describe if the subject had a previous history of colon polyps as noted in the history/physical or previous endoscopic report (s).

ImmediateFamilyHistoryEndometrialCancer.description: Text that describes the age at which the family member was diagnosed with endometrial or uterine cancer in relationship to their 50th birthday.

ImmediateFamilyHistoryOvarianCancer.description: Text that describes the age at which the family member was diagnosed with ovarian cancer in relationship to their 50th birthday.

MLH1PromoterMethylationStatus.description: Text term to define the status of promoter methylation for the MLH1 gene. Note: MLH1 gene is commonly associated with hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal cancer. Testing for methylation of the MLH1 promoter can help distinguish sporadic from inherited cancers.

PatientColonoscopyPerformedIndicator.description: The yes/no indicator that records if the subject has undergone a previous colonoscopy.

PatientInflammatoryBowelDiseasePersonalM.description: The indicator for patient's personal medical history of inflammatory bowel disease (chronic, non-specific disorders of unknown etiology, including Crohn disease and ulcerative colitis).

SizeofPolypRemoved.description: Size of the polyp removed in cm

AgeIsObfuscated.description: The age of the patient has been modified for compliance reasons. The actual age differs from what is reported. Other date intervals for this patient may also be modified.

DaystoBirth.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of birth represented as a calculated negative number of days.

Ethnicity.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

Gender.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

OccupationDurationYears.description: The number of years a patient worked in a specific occupation.

PrematureAtBirth.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was premature (less than 37 weeks gestation) at birth.

Race.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation withina a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution.

VitalStatus.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

WeeksGestationatBirth.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of weeks starting from the approximate date of the biological mother's last menstrual period and ending with the birth of the patient.

YearOfBirth.description: Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.

AJCCClinicalM.description:
Extent of the distant metastasis for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical
 assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

AJCCClinicalN.description:
Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from
 clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

AJCCClinicalStage.description:
Stage group determined from clinical information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and
 metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for cancer.

AJCCClinicalT.description:
Extent of the primary cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters
 determined prior to treatment.

AJCCPathologicM.description:
Code to represent the defined absence or presence of distant spread or metastases (M) to
 locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes, using
 criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

AJCCPathologicN.description:
The codes that represent the stage of cancer based on the nodes present (N stage) according
 to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

AJCCPathologicStage.description:
The extent of a cancer, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to
 other parts of the body based on AJCC staging criteria.

AJCCPathologicT.description:
Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the
 primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer
 (AJCC).

AJCCStagingSystemEdition.description:
The text term used to describe the version or edition of the American Joint Committee on Cancer
 Staging Handbooks, a publication by the group formed for the purpose of developing a system of
 staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with
 other accepted classifications.

AgeatDiagnosis.description: Age at the time of diagnosis expressed in number of days since birth.

AnaplasiaPresent.description:
Yes/no/unknown/Not Reported indicator used to describe whether anaplasia was present at the
time of diagnosis.

AnaplasiaPresentType.description: The text term used to describe the morphologic findings indicating the presence of a malignant cellular infiltrate characterized by the presence of large pleomorphic cells, necrosis, and high mitotic activity in a tissue sample.

BestOverallResponse.description: The best improvement achieved throughout the entire course of protocol treatment.

BreslowThickness.description: The number that describes the distance, in millimeters, between the upper layer of the epidermis and the deepest point of tumor penetration.

ClassificationofTumor.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

CogNeuroblastomaRiskGroup.description: Text term that represents the categorization of patients on the basis of prognostic factors per a system developed by Children's Oncology Group (COG). Risk level is used to assign treatment intensity.

CogRhabdomyosarcomaRiskGroup.description: Text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma, as defined by the Children's Oncology Group (COG).

DaystoDiagnosis.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with the malignant disease.

DaystoLastFollowup.description: Time interval from the date of last follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

DaystoLastKnownDiseaseStatus.description: Time interval from the date of last follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

FirstSymptomPriortoDiagnosis.description: Text term used to describe the patient's first symptom experienced prior to diagnosis and thought to be related to the disease.

GleasonGradeGroup.description: The text term used to describe the overall grouping of grades defined by the Gleason grading classification, which is used to determine the aggressiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.

GleasonGradeTertiary.description: The text term used to describe the tertiary pattern as described by the Gleason Grading System.

GleasonPatternsPercent.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of Patterns 4 and 5, which is used when the Gleason score is greater than 7 to predict prognosis.

GreatestTumorDimension.description: Numeric value that represents the measurement of the widest portion of the tumor in centimeters.

GrossTumorWeight.description: Numeric value used to describe the gross pathologic tumor weight, measured in grams.

IGCCCGStage.description: The text term used to describe the International Germ Cell Cancer Collaborative Group (IGCCCG), a grouping used to further classify metastatic testicular tumors.

INPCGrade.description: Text term used to describe the classification of neuroblastic differentiation within neuroblastoma tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC).

INPCHistologicGroup.description: The text term used to describe the classification of neuroblastomas distinguishing between favorable and unfavorable histologic groups. The histologic score, defined by the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC), is based on age, mitosis-karyorrhexis index (MKI), stromal content and degree of tumor cell differentiation.

INRGStage.description: The text term used to describe the staging classification of neuroblastic tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Risk Group (INRG).

INSSStage.description: Text term used to describe the staging classification of neuroblastic tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Staging System (INSS).

IRSGroup.description: Text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma tumors, as defined by the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study (IRS).

IRSStage.description: The text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma tumors, as defined by the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study (IRS).

ISSStage.description: The multiple myeloma disease stage at diagnosis.

InternationalPrognosticIndex.description: The text term used to describe the International Prognostic Index, which classifies the prognosis of patients with aggressive non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

LastKnownDiseaseStatus.description: Text term that describes the last known state or condition of an individual's neoplasm.

Laterality.description: For tumors in paired organs, designates the side on which the cancer originates.

LymphNodeInvolvedSite.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of lymph node involvement.

LymphNodesPositive.description: The number of lymph nodes involved with disease as determined by pathologic examination.

LymphNodesTested.description: The number of lymph nodes tested to determine whether lymph nodes were involved with disease as determined by a pathologic examination.

LymphaticInvasionPresent.description: A yes/no indicator to ask if small or thin-walled vessel invasion is present, indicating lymphatic involvement

MarginDistance.description: Numeric value (in centimeters) that represents the distance between the tumor and the surgical margin.

MarginsInvolvedSite.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic sites that were involved in the survival margins.

MedulloblastomaMolecularClassification.description: The text term used to describe the classification of medulloblastoma tumors based on molecular features.

MetastasisatDiagnosis.description: The text term used to describe the extent of metastatic disease present at diagnosis.

MetastasisatDiagnosisSite.description: Text term to identify an anatomic site in which metastatic disease involvement is found.

MethodofDiagnosis.description: Text term used to describe the method used to confirm the patients malignant diagnosis.

MicropapillaryFeatures.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether micropapillary features were determined to be present.

MitosisKaryorrhexisIndex.description: Text term that represents the component of the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC) for mitosis-karyorrhexis index (MKI).

MitoticCount.description: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors. The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined. Usually, the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.

Morphology.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

NonNodalRegionalDisease.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient had non-nodal regional disease.

NonNodalTumorDeposits.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe the presence of tumor deposits in the pericolic or perirectal fat or in adjacent mesentery away from the leading edge of the tumor.

OvarianSpecimenStatus.description: The text term used to describe the physical condition of the involved ovary.

OvarianSurfaceInvolvement.description: The text term that describes whether the surface tissue (outer boundary) of the ovary shows evidence of involvement or presence of cancer.

PercentTumorInvasion.description: The percentage of tumor cells spread locally in a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue.

PerineuralInvasionPresent.description: A yes/no indicator to ask if perineural invasion or infiltration of tumor or cancer is present.

PeritonealFluidCytologicalStatus.description: The text term used to describe the malignant status of the peritoneal fluid determined by cytologic testing.

PregnantatDiagnosis.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient was pregnant at the time they were diagnosed.

PrimaryDiagnosis.description: Text term used to describe the patient's histologic diagnosis, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

PrimaryGleasonGrade.description: The text term used to describe the primary Gleason score, which describes the pattern of cells making up the largest area of the tumor. The primary and secondary Gleason pattern grades are combined to determine the patient's Gleason grade group, which is used to determine the aggresiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.

PriorMalignancy.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe the patient's history of prior cancer diagnosis.

PriorTreatment.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

ProgressionorRecurrence.description: Yes/No/unknown indicator to identify whether a patient has had a new tumor event after initial treatment.

ResidualDisease.description: Text terms to describe the status of a tissue margin following surgical resection.

SecondaryGleasonGrade.description: The text term used to describe the secondary Gleason score, which describes the pattern of cells making up the second largest area of the tumor. The primary and secondary Gleason pattern grades are combined to determine the patient's Gleason grade group, which is used to determine the aggresiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.

SiteofResectionorBiopsy.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of origin, of the patient's malignant disease, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

SupratentorialLocalization.description: Text term to specify the location of the supratentorial tumor.

SynchronousMalignancy.description: A yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient had an additional malignant diagnosis at the same time the tumor used for sequencing was diagnosed. If both tumors were sequenced, both tumors would have synchronous malignancies.

TissueorOrganofOrigin.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of origin, of the patient's malignant disease, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

TumorConfinedtoOrganofOrigin.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the tumor is confined to the organ where it originated and did not spread to a proximal or distant location within the body.

TumorDepth.description: Numeric value that represents the depth of tumor invasion, measured in millimeters (mm).

TumorFocality.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient's disease originated in a single location or multiple locations.

TumorGrade.description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.

TumorLargestDimensionDiameter.description: Numeric value used to describe the maximum diameter or dimension of the primary tumor, measured in centimeters.

VascularInvasionPresent.description: The yes/no indicator to ask if large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen.

VascularInvasionType.description: Text term that represents the type of vascular tumor invasion.

YearofDiagnosis.description: Numeric value to represent the year of an individual's initial pathologic diagnosis of cancer.

AlcoholExposure.description: Indicate if individual has alcohol exposure

AsbestosExposure.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was exposed to asbestos.

CoalDustExposure.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to fine powder derived by the crushing of coal.

EnvironmentalTobaccoSmokeExposure.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to smoke that is emitted from burning tobacco, including cigarettes, pipes, and cigars. This includes tobacco smoke exhaled by smokers.

RadonExposure.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was exposed to radon.

RespirableCrystallineSilicaExposure.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposured to respirable crystalline silica, a widespread, naturally occurring, crystalline metal oxide that consists of different forms including quartz, cristobalite, tridymite, tripoli, ganister, chert and novaculite.

SmokingExposure.description: Indicate if individual has smoking exposure

RelativewithCancerHistory.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether any of the patient's relatives have a history of cancer.

AIDSRiskFactors.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor of the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) that the patient either had at time time of the study or experienced in the past.

AdverseEvent.description: Text that represents the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events low level term name for an adverse event.

AdverseEventGrade.description: The text term used to describe a specific histone variants, which are proteins that substitute for the core canonical histones.

BMI.description: A calculated numerical quantity that represents an individual's weight to height ratio.

BodySurfaceArea.description: Numeric value used to represent the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface relating height to weight.

CD4Count.description: The text term used to describe the outcome of the procedure to determine the amount of the CD4 expressing cells in a sample.

CDCHIVRiskFactors.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor for human immunodeficiency virus, as described by the Center for Disease Control.

CauseofResponse.description: The text term used to describe the suspected cause or reason for the patient disease response.

Comorbidity.description: The text term used to describe a comorbidity disease, which coexists with the patient's malignant disease.

ComorbidityMethodofDiagnosis.description: The text term used to describe the method used to diagnose the patient's comorbidity disease.

DLCORefPredictivePercent.description: The value, as a percentage of predicted lung volume, measuring the amount of carbon monoxide detected in a patient's lungs.

DaystoAdverseEvent.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's adverse event.

DaystoComorbidity.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with a comorbidity.

DaystoFollowUp.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's last follow-up appointment or contact.

DaystoImaging.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the imaging or scan was performed on the patient.

DiabetesTreatmentType.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage diabetes.

DiseaseResponse.description: Code assigned to describe the patient's response or outcome to the disease.

ECOGPerformanceStatus.description: The ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.

EvidenceofRecurrenceType.description: The text term used to describe the type of evidence used to determine whether the patient's disease recurred

FEV1FVCPostBronchPercent.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) post-bronchodilator.

FEV1FVCPreBronchPercent.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) pre-bronchodilator.

FEV1RefPostBronchPercent.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second post-bronchodilator.

FEV1RefPreBronchPercent.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second pre-bronchodilator.

HAARTTreatmentIndicator.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient received Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy (HAART).

HIVViralLoad.description: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.

HPVPositiveType.description: Text classification to represent the strain or type of human papillomavirus identified in an individual.

Height.description: The height of the patient in centimeters.

HepatitisSustainedVirologicalResponse.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient received treatment for a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

HormonalContraceptiveUse.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient used hormonal contraceptives.

HysterectomyMarginsInvolved.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient's disease was determined to be involved based on the surgical margins of the hysterectomy.

HysterectomyType.description: The text term used to describe the type of hysterectomy the patient had.

ImagingResult.description: The text term used to describe the result of the imaging or scan performed on the patient.

ImagingType.description: The text term used to describe the type of imaging or scan performed on the patient.

ImmunosuppressiveTreatmentType.description: The text term used to describe the type of immunosuppresive treatment the patient received.

KarnofskyPerformanceStatus.description: Text term used to describe the classification used of the functional capabilities of a person.

MenopauseStatus.description: Text term used to describe the patient's menopause status.

NadirCD4Count.description: Numeric value that represents the lowest point to which the CD4 count has dropped (nadir).

PregnancyOutcome.description: The text term used to describe the type of pregnancy the patient had

RecistTargetedRegionsNumber.description: Numeric value that represents the number of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria

RecistTargetedRegionsSum.description: Numeric value that represents the sum of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.

RefluxTreatmentType.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

RiskFactor.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

RiskFactorTreatment.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient received treatment for a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

ScanTracerUsed.description: The text term used to describe the type of tracer used during the imaging or scan of the patient.

ViralHepatitisSerologies.description: Text term that describes the kind of serological laboratory test used to determine the patient's hepatitus status.

Weight.description: The weight of the patient measured in kilograms.

CurrentLungCancerSymptoms.description: Reported lung cancer related symptoms person is currently experiencing

LungAdjacentHistologyType.description: The type of morphologic characteristics observed by microscope in the tissue next to a benign or malignant tissue growth

LungCancerDetectionMethodType.description: The means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions performed in order to discover or identify lung cancer

LungCancerHarboringGenomicAberrations.description: Genomic aberrations in participants with lung cancer (specific lung cancer associated gene mutations not covered in Tiers 1 and 2)

LungCancerParticipantProcedureHistory.description: Text name of a surgical or operative procedure used in a natural history protocol of a lung cancer participant.

LungTopography.description: Lung PCA specific topography (not covered in previous tiers)

LungTumorLobeBronchialLocation.description: Anatomic lobe and bronchial location of the tumor inside the lung

LungTumorLocationAnatomicSite.description: Anatomic location of the tumor inside the lung

CutaneousMelanomaAdditionalFindings.description: Significant pathologic finding present in addition to the cutaneous melanoma.

CutaneousMelanomaSurgicalMargins.description: Text term to indicate presence of tumor at resection margins

CutaneousMelanomaTumorInfiltratingLympho.description: Description of degree of lymphocytic infiltration surrounding and disrupting tumor cells of the vertical growth phase in a cutaneous melanoma.

CutaneousMelanomaTumorRegressionRange.description: Description of the degree to which tumor cells are replaced by lymphocytic inflammation with or without dermal melanophages and fibrosis._Range; the difference between the lowest and highest numerical values.

CutaneousMelanomaUlceration.description: Description of extent of disruption to the surface of the skin caused by the cutaneous melanoma.

FitzpatrickSkinTone.description: The Fitzpatrick classification of skin phototype

HistoryofAtypicalNevi.description: Patient has a history of atypical nevi

HistoryofBlisteringSunburn.description: Patient has history of blistering sunburn

HistoryofTanningBedUse.description: History of tanning bed use of the patient

ImmediateFamilyHistoryMelanoma.description: Text that describes the age at which the family member was diagnosed with melanoma skin cancer in relationship to their 50th birthday.

MelanomaBiopsyResectionSites.description: Biopsy resection sites specific to melanoma (not covered in Tiers 1 and 2)

MelanomaLesionSize.description: Diameter of lesion determined on skin examination (pre-bx), in mm

MelanomaSpecimenClarkLevelValue.description: Definition of the Clark level or depth of involvement of a melanoma in the skin or a specimen.

AAChange.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the amino acid change for a specific genetic variant. Example: R116Q. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

Antigen.description: The text term used to describe an antigen included in molecular testing. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

BloodTestNormalRangeLower.description: Numeric value used to describe the lower limit of the normal range used to describe a healthy individual at the institution where the test was completed.

BloodTestNormalRangeUpper.description: Numeric value used to describe the upper limit of the normal range used to describe a healthy individual at the institution where the test was completed.

CellCount.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of cells used for molecular testing. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

Chromosome.description: The text term used to describe a chromosome targeted or included in molecular testing. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the chromosome where that variant is located. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

ClinicalBiospecimenType.description: The text term used to describe the biological material used for testing, diagnostic, treatment or research purposes. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

Clonality.description: The text term used to describe whether a genomic variant is related by descent from a single progenitor cell. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

CopyNumber.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of times a section of the genome is repeated or copied within an insertion, duplication or deletion variant. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

Cytoband.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the cytoband or chromosomal location targeted or included in molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the cytoband where the variant is located. Format: [chromosome][chromosome arm].[band+sub-bands]. Example: 17p13.1. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

Exon.description: Exon number targeted or included in a molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the exon where that variant is located. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

GeneSymbol.description: The text term used to describe a gene targeted or included in molecular analysis. For rearrangements, this is should be used to represent the reference gene. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

HistoneFamily.description: The text term used to describe the family, or classification of a group of basic proteins found in chromatin, called histones.

HistoneVariant.description: The text term used to describe a specific histone variants, which are proteins that substitute for the core canonical histones.

Intron.description: Intron number targeted or included in molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the intron where that variant is located.

LaboratoryTest.description: The text term used to describe the medical testing used to diagnose, treat or further understand a patient's disease.

LociAbnormalCount.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of loci determined to be abnormal.

LociCount.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of loci tested.

Locus.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the locus of a specific genetic variant. Example: NM_001126114.

MismatchRepairMutation.description: The yes/no/unknown indicator used to describe whether the mutation included in molecular testing was known to have an affect on the mismatch repair process. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

MolecularAnalysisMethod.description: The text term used to describe the method used for molecular analysis. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

MolecularConsequence.description: The text term used to describe the molecular consequence of genetic variation. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

Pathogenicity.description: The text used to describe a variant's level of involvement in the cause of the patient's disease according to the standards outlined by the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics (ACMG).

Ploidy.description: Text term used to describe the number of sets of homologous chromosomes.

SecondExon.description: The second exon number involved in molecular variation. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the second exon where that variant is located. This property is typically used for a translocation where two different locations are involved in the variation.

SecondGeneSymbol.description: The text term used to describe a secondary gene targeted or included in molecular analysis. For rearrangements, this is should represent the location of the variant. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

SpecializedMolecularTest.description: Text term used to describe a specific test that is not covered in the list of molecular analysis methods. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

TestAnalyteType.description: The text term used to describe the type of analyte used for molecular testing. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

TestResult.description: The text term used to describe the result of the molecular test. If the test result was a numeric value see test_value. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

TestUnits.description: The text term used to describe the units of the test value for a molecular test. This property is used in conjunction with test_value. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

TestValue.description: The text term or numeric value used to describe a specific result of a molecular test. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here

Transcript.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the transcript of a specific genetic variant. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

VariantOrigin.description: The text term used to describe the biological origin of a specific genetic variant. Note: This node is meant to capture molecular tests that were completed clinically for the participant and only includes data from diagnostic array that was completed prior to research sequencing was done. Do not include data related to research assay outputs here.

VariantType.description: The text term used to describe the type of genetic variation.

Zygosity.description: The text term used to describe the zygosity of a specific genetic variant.

OvarianCancerHistologicSubtype.description: Text term to describe the histological subtype of ovarian cancer in the participant

OvarianCancerPlatinumStatus.description: Text term to indicate the status of treatment with platinum in participant with ovarian cancer

OvarianCancerSurgicalOutcome.description: Text term that describes the kind of surgical treatment administered.

PancreasPrecancerHistopathologicGrade.description: The grade of precancerous pancreatic tissue based on microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

PancreaticDuctFinalPathologyType.description: The final pathology result of the pancreatic duct communication type.

PancreaticIPMNPathologyEpithelialSubtype.description: The Intraductal Papillary Mucinous Neoplasm (IPMN) epithelial cell subtype based on the gross and microscopic examination of a pancreatic neoplasm specimen

LocationExtentExtraprostaticExtension.description: Location and extent of extraprostatic extension

LocationNaturePositiveMargins.description: Location and nature of positive margins

ProstateCancerCytologicMorphologicSubtyp.description: Text term that describes various morphological and cytological subtypes in protate tumors.

ProstateCancerLocalExtent.description: The response used to categorize the local extent of disease for prostate cancer.

ProstateCarcinomaHistologicType.description: The diagnostic subclassification of an invasive prostate carcinoma.

SeminalVesicleInvasion.description: An anatomic position identifying a side of the body where local spread of malignant neoplasm is found to infiltrate tissue in the saclike glandular diverticulum on the ductus deferens in a male.

SarcomaDiagnosisClassificationCategory.description: High level grouping to describe a diagnostic grouping or category for sarcoma, a malignant mesenchymal cell tumor most commonly arising from muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, bone, cartilage, and blood vessels.

SarcomaSubtype.description: The subtype related to the scientific determination and investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms of tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation.

SarcomaTumorExtensionType.description: The field to indicate the organs and structures to which the tumor has become adherent or has invaded.

ChemoConcurrenttoRadiation.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient was receiving chemotherapy concurrent to radiation.

DaystoTreatmentEnd.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the treatment ended.

DaystoTreatmentStart.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the treatment started.

InitialDiseaseStatus.description: The text term used to describe the status of the patient's malignancy when the treatment began.

NumberofCycles.description: The numeric value used to describe the number of cycles of a specific treatment or regimen the patient received.

ReasonTreatmentEnded.description: The text term used to describe the reason a specific treatment or regimen ended.

RegimenorLineofTherapy.description: The text term used to describe the regimen or line of therapy.

TherapeuticAgents.description: Text identification of the individual agent(s) used as part of a treatment regimen.

TreatmentAnatomicSite.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of resection; biopsy; tissue or organ of biospecimen origin; progression or recurrent disease; treatment

TreatmentArm.description: Text term used to describe the treatment arm assigned to a patient at the time eligibility is determined.

TreatmentDose.description: The numeric value used to describe the dose of an agent the patient received.

TreatmentDoseUnits.description: The text term used to describe the dose units of an agent the patient received.

TreatmentEffect.description: The text term used to describe the pathologic effect a treatment(s) had on the tumor.

TreatmentEffectIndicator.description: The text term used to indicate whether the treatment had an effect on the patient.

TreatmentFrequency.description: The text term used to describe the frequency the patient received an agent or regimen.

TreatmentIntentType.description: Text term to identify the reason for the administration of a treatment regimen. [Manually-curated]

TreatmentOutcome.description: Text term that describes the patient's final outcome after the treatment was administered.

TreatmentType.description: Text term that describes the kind of treatment administered.

TreatmentorTherapy.description: A yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received.

program.yaml.title: Program
program.yaml.description: A broad framework of goals to be achieved. (NCIt C52647)

dbgap_accession_number.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the program.

project.yaml.title: Project
project.yaml.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

name.description: Display name/brief description for the project.

date_collected.description: The date or date range in which the project data was collected.

availability_type.description: Is the project open or restricted?

availability_mechanism.description: Mechanism by which the project will be made avilable.

support_source.description: The name of source providing support/grant resources.

support_id.description: The ID of the source providing support/grant resources.

programs.description: Indicates that the project is logically part of the indicated project.

state.description:
The possible states a project can be in.  All but `open` are
equivalent to some type of locked state.

released.description:
To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted
entities in the next GDC index.

releasable.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

intended_release_date.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

dbgap_accession_number.description: The dbgap accession number provided for the project. (CMG)

short_name.description: The shorthand name for the project.

full_name.description: The full name for the project.

study_registration.description: External source from which the identifier included in study_id originates

study_id.description: Unique identifier that can be used to retrieve more information for a study

therapy.yaml.title: Therapy
therapy.yaml.description: Individual's first line of therapy or treatment

ChemoConcurrenttoRadiation.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient was receiving chemotherapy concurrent to radiation.

Component.description: Category of metadata (e.g. Diagnosis, Biospecimen, scRNA-seq Level 1, etc.); provide the same one for all items/rows.

DaystoTreatmentEnd.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the treatment ended.

DaystoTreatmentStart.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the treatment started.

HTANParticipantID.description: HTAN ID associated with a patient based on HTAN ID SOP (eg HTANx_yyy )

InitialDiseaseStatus.description: The text term used to describe the status of the patient's malignancy when the treatment began.

NumberofCycles.description: The numeric value used to describe the number of cycles of a specific treatment or regimen the patient received.

ReasonTreatmentEnded.description: The text term used to describe the reason a specific treatment or regimen ended.

RegimenorLineofTherapy.description: The text term used to describe the regimen or line of therapy.

TherapeuticAgents.description: Text identification of the individual agent(s) used as part of a treatment regimen.

TreatmentAnatomicSite.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of resection; biopsy; tissue or organ of biospecimen origin; progression or recurrent disease; treatment

TreatmentArm.description: Text term used to describe the treatment arm assigned to a patient at the time eligibility is determined.

TreatmentDose.description: The numeric value used to describe the dose of an agent the patient received.

TreatmentDoseUnits.description: The text term used to describe the dose units of an agent the patient received.

TreatmentEffect.description: The text term used to describe the pathologic effect a treatment(s) had on the tumor.

TreatmentEffectIndicator.description: The text term used to indicate whether the treatment had an effect on the patient.

TreatmentFrequency.description: The text term used to describe the frequency the patient received an agent or regimen.

TreatmentIntentType.description: Text term to identify the reason for the administration of a treatment regimen. [Manually-curated]

TreatmentOutcome.description: Text term that describes the patient's final outcome after the treatment was administered.

TreatmentType.description: Text term that describes the kind of treatment administered.
